item.title: Is it possible to delete frames ? look inside plz
item.dc:creator: @jonaske jonaske
item.description:
@jonaske wrote:

i tought this

public void frame70(int i1, int i2, int i3) // interface thing, not sure { if (playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == ... || playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == ..) { outStream.createFrame(70); outStream.writeWord(i1); // offset X outStream.writeWordBigEndian(i2); // offset Y outStream.writeWordBigEndian(i3); // interface, definatly. updateRequired = true; appearanceUpdateRequired = true; } else { outStream.createFrame(70) = false; // outStream.writeWord(i1) = false ; // offset X outStream.writeWordBigEndian(i2) = false; // offset Y outStream.writeWordBigEndian(i3)= false; // interface, definatly. updateRequired = true; appearanceUpdateRequired = true; } }

in compiler it says [code]client.java:3483: unexpected type
required: variable
found : value
outStream.createFrame(70) = false;

                                 ^

client.java:3484: unexpected type
required: variable
found : value
outStream.writeWord(i1) = false ; // offset X
^
client.java:3485: unexpected type
required: variable
found : value
outStream.writeWordBigEndian(i2) = false; // offset Y
^
client.java:3486: unexpected type
required: variable
found : value
outStream.writeWordBigEndian(i3)= false; // interface, definatly
.
^
Note: stream.java uses or overrides a deprecated API.
Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details.
4 errors
Druk op een toets om door te gaan. . .[/code]
but it doesn’t work maybe u can fix?
maybe u can try with showframe because i don’t have it
or can u just give the void so ican try

item.dc:creator: @Xbox_Modder Xbox Modder
item.description:
@Xbox_Modder wrote:

public void showFrame121(int i1, int i2) {
outStream.createFrame(121);
outStream.writeWord(i1);
outStream.writeByteS(i2);
sendMessage("Frame 121 tested");
		}

Now Under public boolean process make something like

		if (playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == 1234) { //name here?
			showFrame121() = true;
		}else{
			showFrame121() = false;

}

Do something like

public void frame121(int i1, int i2) // MUSIC! this one used alot less often though Big Grin
{
playerequip 1234
outStream.createFrame(121);
outStream.writeWord(i1);
outStream.writeByteS(i2);
sendMessage(“Frame 121 tested”);
}
else
showframe = false;

But not exactly that…

But what that willdo is make the frame showup when your wearing it but when your not it doesn’t show…

item.title: Is it possible to delete frames ? look inside plz
item.dc:creator: @jonaske jonaske
item.description:
@jonaske wrote:

well when u have soemthing like this

public void frame121(int i1, int i2) // MUSIC! this one used alot less often though
{
playerequip 1234
outStream.createFrame(121);
outStream.writeWord(i1);
outStream.writeByteS(i2);
sendMessage(“Frame 121 tested”);
}

say that it gives eem a spec bar or a bar or soemthing when u wear the 1234

but when i wear another item 1111 then its still there
can i do soemthing so it deletes it?

thnx
